se.jguru.nazgul.core.cache.api.distributed

Interface DistributedCache<K,V>

  • Type Parameters:
    K - The type of key used within this DistributedCache.
    V - The type of value used within this DistributedCache.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Cache<K,V>, Clusterable, Iterable<K>, Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DestinationProvider<K,V>, DistributedExecutor<K,V>

    public interface DistributedCache<K,V>
extends Cache<K,V>
    Service interface definition for a distributed (clustered) cache.
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  DistributedCache.DistributedCollectionType
      Type indication for the distributed collection.

    • Method Detail

      • getClusterUniqueID

        @NotNull
String getClusterUniqueID()
        Returns:
        An identifier unique to the active cache cluster, but different for each time this method is called. (I.e. a cluster-wide sequence of some kind).

      • getDistributedCollection

        Collection<? extends V> getDistributedCollection(@NotNull
                                                 DistributedCache.DistributedCollectionType type,
                                                 @NotNull
                                                 String key)
                                          throws ClassCastException,
                                                 UnsupportedDistributionException
        Gets a distributed collection with the given type and provided key from the cache. Note that the distributed Collection will be created on the provided key if it does not already exist. A typical usage example would be 
          Collection cachedList = getDistributedCollection(COLLECTION, "someKey");
        Parameters:
        type - The type of Collection desired. This should be an abstract type, such as Collection, Set or Queue etc.
        key - The key where the distributed collection resides or will be created to.
        Returns:
        The created (empty) or acquired (potentially not empty) distributed collection cached at the given key.
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - if the cache key [key]Â maps to an object not of the given type.
        UnsupportedDistributionException - if the underlying cache implementation could not support creating a distributed collection of the given type.

      • getDistributedMap

        <MapKeyType,MapValueType> Map<MapKeyType,MapValueType> getDistributedMap(@NotNull
                                                                         String key)
                                                                  throws UnsupportedDistributionException
        Gets a distributed Map with the provided key from the cache. Note that the distributed Map will be created on the provided key if it does not already exist.
        Type Parameters:
        MapKeyType - The key type used within the distributed Map.
        MapValueType - The value type used within the distributed Map.
        Parameters:
        key - The key where the distributed Map resides or will be created to.
        Returns:
        The created (empty) or acquired (potentially not empty) distributed Map cached at the given key.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedDistributionException - if the underlying cache implementation could not support creating a distributed Map.

      • addListenerFor

        boolean addListenerFor(@NotNull
                       Object distributedObject,
                       @NotNull
                       CacheListener<K,V> listener)
                throws IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a CacheListener to the distributed object. The cacheListener will be invoked when the properties/items/key-value pairs of the distributed object are altered. This operation may be an asynchronous operation depending on the underlying cache implementation.
        Parameters:
        distributedObject - The distributed object from which we should listen to changes.
        listener - The CacheListener to register to the given distributed object.
        Returns:
        true if the CacheListener was successfully registered, and false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the distributedObject was not appropriate for registering a CacheListener (i.e. incorrect type for the underlying cache implementation).

      • removeListenerFor

        void removeListenerFor(@NotNull
                       Object distributedObject,
                       @NotNull
                       String cacheListenerId)
                throws IllegalArgumentException
        Removes the given CacheListener from the distributed object. This operation may be an asynchronous operation depending on the underlying cache implementation.
        Parameters:
        distributedObject - The distributed object from which we should remove the CacheListener.
        cacheListenerId - The ID of the CacheListener to remove from the given distributed object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the distributedObject was not appropriate for removing a CacheListener (i.e. incorrect type for the underlying cache implementation).

      • getListenersIDsFor

        List<String> getListenersIDsFor(@NotNull
                                Object distributedObject)
        Retrieves all IDs of the CacheListeners bound to the given distributedObject.
        Parameters:
        distributedObject - The distributedObject whose CacheListener IDs we should retrieve.
        Returns:
        The IDs of all CacheListener instances registered to the provided distributedObject.
